item.title: 甲骨文冲击股市，美联储信息影响美元走势
item.description: 美国云计算巨头甲骨文公司（Oracle）令人失望的财报为人工智能的盈利能力敲响了警钟，周四亚洲股市震荡，而美联储下调美国利率后，债券坚挺，美元止跌回升。【原文：Stocks wobbled around Asia on Thursday after disappointing earnings at U.S. cloud computing giant Oracle sounded a warning for AI profitability, while bonds were firm and the dollar nursed losses after the Federal Reserve cut U.S. interest rates.】

item.title: 美联储可能不会让特朗普降息，但对 2026 年经济持积极看法
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会（U.S. Federal Reserve）可能不会给唐纳德-特朗普总统想要的所有降息措施，但决策者们周三在新的经济预测中对经济的看法应该会让政府感到振奋，因为在 2026 年中期选举之前，美国经济将保持较快的增长、较低的通胀和稳定的失业率。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve may not give President Donald Trump all the rate cuts he wants, but the view of the economy policymakers included in new economic projections on Wednesday should buoy the administration nonetheless with its outlook for faster growth, lower inflation and steady unemployment heading into the 2026 midterm elections.】

item.title: 美联储鹰派受挫，美元下滑，市场期待再降息两次
item.description: 美元周四下跌，因为美联储发表的展望不像一些人预期的那样鹰派，这给了投资者做空美元的信心，因为他们押注明年还会有两次降息。【原文：The dollar fell on Thursday after the Federal Reserve delivered an outlook that was not as hawkish as some had anticipated, giving investors confidence to short the currency as they bet on two more rate cuts next year.】

item.title: 美国在委内瑞拉附近扣押油轮后，石油涨势扩大
item.description: 周四，石油连续第二个交易日上涨，此前美国在委内瑞拉沿海扣押了一艘受制裁的油轮，两国之间的紧张局势升级，并引发了对进一步供应中断的担忧。【原文：Oil rose for a second straight session on Thursday after the U.S. seized a sanctioned oil tanker off Venezuela’s coast, escalating tensions between the two countries and raising concern over further supply disruptions.】

item.title: 媒体报道后，马斯克在 X 博文中暗示 SpaceX 可能进行 IPO
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周三在社交媒体上与Ars Technica太空记者埃里克-伯杰（Eric Berger）交流时暗示，SpaceX可能进行首次公开募股，此前有报道称这家火箭制造商可能在2026年上市。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk on Wednesday hinted at a possible SpaceX initial public offering in a social media exchange with Ars Technica space journalist Eric Berger, following reports of a possible listing of the rocket maker in 2026.】

item.title: 澳大利亚领导人为社交媒体禁令辩护，因为青少年吹嘘自己一直在上网
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞承认，在全球首次禁止 16 岁以下青少年使用社交媒体的禁令生效一天后，仍有一些年轻人在使用社交媒体，他说，这项禁令的推出总是磕磕绊绊，但最终会拯救生命。【原文：Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese acknowledged some young people were still on social media a day after a world-first ban on under-16s went live, saying the rollout was always going to be bumpy but would ultimately save lives.】

item.title: 苹果公司首席执行官以隐私问题为由，推动修改美国儿童网络安全法案
item.description: 苹果公司首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）周三会见了美国众议院议员，回击了可能要求这家 iPhone 制造商验证用户年龄并可能收集儿童敏感数据的联邦立法，转而游说将决定是否告知应用程序商店儿童年龄的责任推给父母。【原文：Apple CEO Tim Cook met U.S. House members on Wednesday to push back against federal legislation that could require the iPhone maker to authenticate users' ages and possibly collect sensitive data on children, lobbying instead to put the onus on parents to decide whether to tell app stores about a child's age.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，中国中兴通讯可能因外国贿赂指控向美国支付超过 10 亿美元的赔偿金
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的人士透露，中国电信设备制造商中兴通讯（ZTE Corp）可能向美国政府支付超过 10 亿美元，以解决多年来的外国贿赂指控。【原文：Chinese telecom equipment maker ZTE Corp may pay more than $1 billion to the U.S. government to resolve years-old allegations of foreign bribery, according to two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 投资者反感西太平洋银行与澳大利亚证券交易所的关系后，西太平洋银行董事在代理投票中再次当选
item.description: 西太平洋银行（Westpac Banking Corp）非执行董事彼得-纳什（Peter Nash）因与陷入困境的澳大利亚证券交易所（Australian Securities Exchange）的关系而受到投资者的反弹，根据该银行年会的代理投票显示，他似乎没有受到影响。【原文：Westpac Banking Corp non-executive director Peter Nash appeared to have survived an investor backlash due to his ties to the troubled Australian Securities Exchange , according to proxy votes shown at the bank's annual meeting.】

item.title: 威尔士卡森支持的 Lumexa Imaging 在美国首次公开募股中融资 4.63 亿美元
item.description: 美国最大的诊断成像服务提供商之一 Lumexa Imaging 公司周三表示，该公司已在首次公开募股中筹集到 4.625 亿美元。【原文：Lumexa Imaging, one of the largest U.S. diagnostic imaging services providers, said on Wednesday it has raised $462.5 million in its initial public offering.】

item.title: GlobalFoundries 任命 Sam Franklin 担任临时首席财务官
item.description: GlobalFoundries 周三任命 Sam Franklin 为首席财务官，接替今年早些时候卸任的 David Reeder。【原文：GlobalFoundries on Wednesday appointed Sam Franklin as its chief financial officer, succeeding David Reeder, who stepped down earlier this year.】

item.title: 日本企业称中日关系紧张是 2026 年首要关注问题
item.description: 路透社周四的一项调查显示，日本企业表示，在进入 2026 年之际，与中国紧张的外交关系是他们最关心的问题，紧随其后的是美国的贸易政策。【原文：Japanese companies said strained diplomatic relations with China are their primary concern as they head into 2026, followed closely by U.S. trade policies, a Reuters survey showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 美联储恢复购买国债，投资者预期货币市场将有所缓解
item.description: 美联储通过购买国库券再次扩大资产负债表的举措有望缓解货币市场的紧张局势，从而平息投资者对多年来债券投资组合流失导致金融体系流动性过剩的担忧。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s move to expand its balance sheet again by buying Treasury bills is expected to ease money-market strains, calming investor worries that years of bond-portfolio runoff had drained too much liquidity from the financial system.】

item.title: 芯片设计工具需求强劲，Synopsys 收入超出预期
item.description: 受芯片设计工具需求强劲的推动，芯片设计软件供应商 Synopsys 周三公布的第四季度营收超出分析师预期，股价在盘后交易中上涨 5%。【原文：Chip design software provider Synopsys beat analysts estimates for fourth-quarter revenue on Wednesday, driven by strong demand for its chip design tools, sending its shares up 5% in extended trading.】

item.title: 贸易主管称，如果最高法院裁定 IEEPA 关税无效，美国可复制收入模式
item.description: 美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）周三表示，如果最高法院否决使用基于 1977 年法律的关税，美国可以采取其他措施重新获得约 2,000 亿美元的关税收入。【原文：The United States can use other measures to recreate the roughly $200 billion in revenues it is collecting under tariffs based on a 1977 law if the Supreme Court strikes down use of that law, U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 可口可乐任命内部人士恩里克-布劳恩为新任首席执行官
item.description: 可口可乐公司周三任命内部人士亨里克-布劳恩（Henrique Braun）为新任首席执行官，接替詹姆斯-昆西（James Quincey），自 3 月 31 日起生效。【原文：Coca-Cola on Wednesday named insider Henrique Braun as its new CEO, replacing James Quincey, effective March 31.】

item.title: 贸易代表格里尔称，特朗普与巴西总统卢拉就贸易问题进行了多次建设性互动
item.description: 美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）周三表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统与巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）就贸易问题进行了几次建设性的互动，这个拉美国家似乎是一个愿意合作的伙伴。【原文：President Donald Trump has had several constructive interactions on trade with Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, and the Latin American country seems to be a willing partner, U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 交易日：市场为美联储欢呼
item.description: 在美联储降息、美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔对经济增长和通胀前景作出积极展望后，美元下挫，华尔街周三反弹，小型股罗素 2000 指数飙升至新高。【原文：The dollar sank and Wall Street rallied on Wednesday, with the small-cap Russell 2000 index surging to new highs, after the Fed cut interest rates and Chair Jerome Powell offered a positive outlook on the path for growth and inflation.】

item.title: 据 Semafor 报道，谷歌任命阿明-瓦哈达特（Amin Vahdat）为新任人工智能基础设施建设主管
item.description: 据 Semafor 周三援引一份内部备忘录报道，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌已任命长期高管阿明-瓦哈达特（Amin Vahdat）为人工智能基础设施首席技术专家。【原文：Alphabet's Google has appointed longtime executive Amin Vahdat as chief technologist for AI infrastructure, Semafor reported on Wednesday, citing an internal memo, as tech giants pour billions into the computing backbone needed to power artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 温克艾沃斯双胞胎的双子座公司获得美国预测市场许可证
item.description: 由亿万富翁双胞胎泰勒-温克艾沃斯（Tyler Winklevoss）和卡梅隆-温克艾沃斯（Cameron Winklevoss）创办的加密货币平台双子座公司（Gemini）周三表示，它已获得商品期货交易委员会颁发的许可证，可以向美国客户提供预测市场服务。【原文：Gemini, the crypto platform founded by billionaire twins Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss, said on Wednesday it had received a license from the Commodity Futures Trading Commission to offer prediction markets to U.S. customers.】

item.title: 特朗普称 CNN 应作为华纳兄弟发现交易的一部分出售
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周三表示，CNN 应作为其母公司华纳兄弟发现公司（Warner Bros Discovery）交易的一部分或单独出售。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday the news network CNN should be sold as part of a deal for its parent company Warner Bros Discovery or separately.】

item.title: 甲骨文季度营收不及预期
item.description: 甲骨文公司周三公布的第二季度营收不及华尔街预期，这表明在人工智能市场泡沫的广泛担忧下，企业对其云服务的支出可能正在降温。【原文：Oracle on Wednesday missed Wall Street estimates for second-quarter revenue, a sign that corporate spending on its cloud services may be cooling amid broader concerns of a bubble in the artificial intelligence market.】

item.title: Adobe 预测年度收入高于预期
item.description: Adobe 公司周三预测 2026 财年的收入将高于华尔街预期，这表明该公司的 Photoshop 设计工具需求强劲，其人工智能产品的货币化程度也在不断提高。【原文：Adobe forecast fiscal 2026 revenue above Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, signaling strong demand for the Photoshop maker's design tools and increasing monetization for its artificial intelligence offerings.】

item.title: 美国利率期货提高了 1 月份暂停加息的几率；仍认为 2026 年会有两次降息
item.description: 衡量银行间无担保隔夜贷款成本的联邦基金利率期货周三提高了美联储在1月份下一次政策会议上暂停宽松周期的可能性。【原文：Futures on the federal funds rate, which measure the cost of unsecured overnight loans between banks, raised the odds on Wednesday that the Federal Reserve will pause its easing cycle at the next policy meeting in January.】

item.title: 美联储降息、鲍威尔发表评论后美元暴跌
item.description: 周三，美元兑欧元、瑞士法郎和日元等主要货币汇率下跌，此前美联储下调利率的举措广受市场预期，但美联储表示可能会在1月份的下一次政策会议上暂停宽松周期。【原文：The U.S. dollar fell against major peers including the euro, Swiss franc, and Japanese yen on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve lowered interest rates in a widely-expected move, but indicated it will likely pause its easing cycle at the next policy meeting in January.】

item.title: 备忘录显示，摩根大通将为年收入低于 8 万美元的员工提供最多 1000 美元的补贴
item.description: 根据路透社周三看到的一份内部备忘录，摩根大通将向全球年收入低于 8 万美元的员工发放最高 1000 美元的特别奖。【原文：JPMorgan Chase will give a special award of up to $1,000 to employees earning less than $80,000 a year globally, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国银行首席执行官预计第四季度市场收入将大幅增长
item.description: 美国银行首席执行官布莱恩-莫伊尼汉（Brian Moynihan）周三表示，他预计该行第四季度的市场业务收入将增长一位数至 10%，而投资银行业务收费将大致持平。【原文：Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan said on Wednesday he expects revenue from the bank's markets business to rise between a high single-digit percentage and 10% in the fourth quarter, while investment banking fees will be broadly flat.】

item.title: OpenAI 警告说，新模型会带来 "高 "网络安全风险
item.description: OpenAI 周三警告说，随着人工智能能力的快速发展，其即将推出的人工智能模型可能会带来 "高 "网络安全风险。【原文：OpenAI on Wednesday warned that its upcoming artificial intelligence models could pose a "high" cybersecurity risk, as their capabilities advance rapidly.】

item.title: 洞察：消息人士称，英特尔追求的交易增加了首席执行官陈立武的财富
item.description: 当人工智能芯片初创公司 Rivos 的董事长希望英特尔竞购该公司时，他没有必要给这家芯片巨头打电话。这是因为 Rivos 的董事长同时也是英特尔的首席执行官：陈立武。【原文：When the chairman of AI chip startup Rivos wanted Intel to bid for the company, he had no need to phone the chip giant. That’s because the chairman of Rivos was also Intel’s CEO: Lip-Bu Tan.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔称特朗普关税导致通胀超调
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周三表示，目前央行2%的通胀目标超调主要是唐纳德-特朗普总统提高进口税的结果。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said Wednesday that the current overshooting of the central bank's 2% inflation target is mostly the result of President Donald Trump's import tax hikes.】
